alert.note: Alert for Schoharie; Western Albany (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 31 at 3:38PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Albany and southern Schoharie Counties through 415 PM EDT... At 337 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Breakabeen, or 9 miles south of Cobleskill, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Gilboa, Livingstonville, North Blenheim, Breakabeen, Conesville, Watsonville, Huntersland, Vorman Corners, Bates, Manorkill, Broome Center, Ruth, West Fulton, East Jefferson, Hawversville, Vintonton, Five Corners, Mackey, Eminence and Franklinton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
